meaningMnemonic: If <kanji>sand</kanji> is <kanji>spread out</kanji> you get the given name <vocabulary>Sara</vocabulary>. You've written your name in sand, right? Now imagine a Sara you know spreading out sand so that it spells her name. Or imagine a pro athlete, like wrestler Doshō Sara (土性 沙羅), judoka Asahina Sara (朝比奈 沙羅), or ski jumper Takanashi Sara (髙梨 沙羅) spreading out the sand. I bet they'd find some skillful ways to do it.
readingMnemonic: This name uses the on'yomi for both kanji, and you learned those readings with the kanji.
